rComments: She assigns work; you do work. It's college. That being said, she is probably the best teacher I've ever had. She KNOWS the material. If you pay attention,do the work, you will too. That's why you pay x dollars to attend college, right? RIGHT?

Prof Rosenzweig is a nice lady who knows the material very well but is extremely demanding considering this is a lower division class. The workload is enormous; almost 50 pages of reading a night, 2 5-7 page papers, reading abstracts, and a take home final that consists of 3 3-4 page essays. Only take this class if you are extremely interested.

Mrs. Rosenzweig does know her material very well. Class is fairly interesting. I would recommend that you only take the class if you are interested in the topic. Much more work than what I would expect from a lower division history course. 3 full novels, 40-60(roughly) pages due every class of reading, 2 essays and a 9-12 page take home final.

Prof Rosenzweig is amazing. She truly cares about her students and wants them to be interested in the material. You have to really work hard to but you learn a lot and have her respect if you seek help. She is always available outside of class for those who take the time to seek her opinions. She is more qualified to teach this class.

Prof Rosenzweig was so awesome. She is funny and entertaining but keeps VERY focused on the topic at hand. She is engaging, and the materials she provides in and outside of class are very educational. Hiiiihgly suggest taking one of her classes no matter the subject
